reviews.review_msg: Peggy is a professor with high intellectual integrity and open-mindedness. I understand some remarked her class is dry. I think her teaching style is more appropriate for graduate classes. I took her class when I was a four year student and had some basic knowledge in the area. I learned alot form her class. Her selection of readings are grt

shes very experienced and gives you every angle of the story... relaxed teaching style and very approachable! very fair marker and great class structure (mt,essay and participation, no final) highly recommended! wait lists for her class are loonnnggg!!
Excellent professor..excellent attitude and certainlly knows a lot!
Hard course if you are not willing to put in the work.

I took one of his upper level Political Science courses last year and despite the rigor he puts you through, the stuff you learn is extremely practical. I can honestly say my level of academic writing would not be where it is at had I not taken his course. For his lower division courses, however, I had a friend tell me he is actually rather easy,

I really enjoyed having classes with Linda. Very knowledgeable, enthusiastic,and easygoing prof. Lectures are long, but interesting and she makes class fun. I already took 2 classes with her and  would take again if I had the opportunity. Mostly take home final exam and fair amounts of assignments.
